description:

Functioning saving and searching.
Tree maintenance also implemented.
rebuild_tree added
name: REMO v6 public

prefix.value: Answer the following questions as best you can. ALWAYS save every message with the saveMemory tool. Never try to store a memory as a key-value pair or in a dictionary format. If you are missing information, ALWAYS use the searchMemory tool. If the user says to organize or maintain your memories, use maintainTree. If the user says to rebuild your tree, use rebuildTree.
prefix.name: prefix

suffix.name: suffix

format_instructions.value:
Use the following format:

Question: the input question you must answer
Thought: you should always think about what to do
Action: the action to take, should be one of [{tool_names}]
Action Input: the input to the action
Observation: the result of the action
... (this Thought/Action/Action Input/Observation can repeat N times)
Thought: I now know the final answer
Final Answer: the final answer to the original input question
format_instructions.name: format_instructions

node.description: Prompt template for Zero Shot Agent.

Wrapper around OpenAI Chat large language models.To use, you should have the ``openai`` python package installed, and theenvironment variable ``OPENAI_API_KEY`` set with your API key.Any parameters that are valid to be passed to the openai.create call can be passedin, even if not explicitly saved on this class.

code.value:
# use this method to save a memory with a POST request to the REMO API
def python_function(memory: str) -> str:
    
    # Step 1: format the memory for url encoding
    from urllib.parse import quote
    formatted_memory = quote(memory)
    
    # Step 2: create an integer timestamp
    import time
    timestamp = int(time.time())
    
    # Step 3: Send the POST request to REMO to save the memory
    import requests
    response = requests.post(f"http://localhost:8000/add_message?message={formatted_memory}&speaker=User&timestamp={timestamp}")
    
    # Step 4: report that the memory has been successfully saved
    return f"The following memory has been saved with REMO: {memory}"
code.name: code

code.value:
# use this method to search for a memory with a GET request to the REMO API
def python_function(memory: str) -> str:
    
    # Step 1: format the memory for url encoding
    from urllib.parse import quote
    formatted_memory = quote(memory)
    
    # Step 2: Send the GET request to REMO to search for the memory
    import requests
    response = requests.get(f"http://localhost:8000/search?query={formatted_memory}")
    
    # Step 3: Return the found memory
    return f'I have found this memory in REMO: {response.json()["results"][0]}'
code.name: code

description.value: Maintains and organizes the AI assistant's permanent memories
description.name: description

code.value:
# Maintain memories by making a POST request to the REMO API
def python_function(memory: str) -> str:
    
    # Step 1: Send POST request to the REMO API to organize memories
    import requests 
    requests.post("http://localhost:8000/maintain_tree")
    
    # Step 2: Report that maintain_tree has been triggered successfully
    return 'Memories in REMO have been successfully organized.'
code.name: code

description.value: Recrreates the memory tree of the AI assistant's permanent memory.
description.name: description

code.value:
# Use this method to rebuild memories by making a POST request to the REMO API
def python_function(memory: str) -> str:
    
    # Step 1: Send POST request to the REMO API to rebuild memories
    import requests 
    requests.post("http://localhost:8000/rebuild_tree")
    
    # Step 2: Report that rebuild_tree has been triggered successfully
    return 'Memory tree in REMO has been successfully rebuilt.'
code.name: code
